caption:
Table 2. Evaluating different settings of the point-wise MLP method. The option 
?, , 2 and 3 denote input features using {?pij, fj}, {fi, ?fij}, {?pij, fi, ?fij}, and 
{?pij, fi, fj, ?fij}, respectively. "Sweet spot" denotes balanced settings regarding both 
efficacy and efficiency. The accuracy on PartNet test set is not tested in ablations to 
avoid the tuning of test set

operators mostly perform marginally worse than the previous best performing 
methods on the three datasets. The baseline  ? operator using a MAX pooling layer 
even slightly outperforms the previous state-of-the-art with smaller computation 
FLOPs (47.4 mIoU, 6.7G FLOPs vs. 46.4 mIoU, 23.1G FLOPs).
